We estimated the magnitude of the derivates ∂THMs/∂T and ∂THMs/∂DOC from the laboratory experiments, using the THMFP measured at 1 mg/L DOC and 15 °C as the closest laboratory data reference point for the water quality observed in the summer months in Scotland (i.e. an average temperature of 14.5 °C and 1.3 mg/L DOC at the point of disinfection for June/July/August). The data then suggested a 3.0 ± 0.2% increase in THM formation per 1 °C temperature increase towards 25 °C, and a 63 ± 4% increase in THM formation per 1 mg/L increase in DOC towards 5 mg/L (Fig. 3).
